item.title: Mount to a remote filesystem with sshfs
item.description: Mount to remote filesystem over SSH with sshfs Installing SSHFS On debian based distro. sudo apt-get install sshfs Mounting the Remote File System Create a local directory in which to mount the remote file system. sudo mkdir /mnt/name Temporarily solution Temporarily with password login sudo sshfs -o allow_other,default_permissions user@ip_address:/ /mnt/name Temporarily with ssh key authentication sudo sshfs -o allow_other,default_permissions,IdentityFile=~/.ssh/id_rsa user@ip_address:/ /mnt/name It is important to note that this process provides only a temporary mount point to your droplet.

item.title: Fresh Raspbian Installation
item.description: Fresh Raspbian Image Burn the image in an SD Card You can use my script: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/TediCreations/.dotfiles/master/files/bin/utils/writeSDCard writeSDCard ~/rasbian.img Enable headless ssh Add a file named “ssh” inside the /boot directory. Add a file named “wpa_supplicant.conf” inside the /boot directory with the following contents. ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=netdev update_config=1 country=us network={ ssid="<Name of your WiFi>" psk="<Password for your WiFi>" scan_ssid=1 } Make it secure Change the default password of user pi

item.title: Disable images at Firefox
item.description: Disable image rendering in Firefox Sometime ago I did not have an ADSL internet connection at home. I managed to make my smartphone a hotspot and accessing its internet connection via my laptop. Disabling the image rendering proved to save some change. You only need to adjust the settings via about:config. Open Firefox Type about: config in the address bar. Search for permissions.default.image and adjust the value to 2.

item.title: Setup transmission daemon on Raspberry Pi
item.description: Intro Hardware used: Raspberry Pi 3B+ Source Setup Update sudo apt update sudo apt upgrade Install transmission sudo apt install transmission-daemon We need to stop the daemon because it is automatically started. sudo systemctl stop transmission-daemon Create torrent directories sudo mkdir -p /media/HDD/torrent-inprogress sudo mkdir -p /media/HDD/torrent-complete Give user pi access over these directories SOS! This had no effect sudo chown -R pi:pi /media/HDD/torrent-inprogress sudo chown -R pi:pi /media/HDD/torrent-complete Configure transmission Edit configuration file
